document_data.title: Polyhedron Newszine
document_data.mainbody: '''''Polyhedron Newszine''''', or ''Polyhedron'', was the official publication of the Role Playing Gamers Association (RPGA). Articles were written by gamers for other gamers in the style of ''[[Dragon (magazine)|Dragon]]'', and information was included on RPGA membership and events.

History.TSR: The majority of issues were published by [[TSR, Inc.]], from May 1981 to April 2000. The magazine was titled ''TSR RPGA'' from May 1981 to February 1982.
History.Merging with Dungeon Magazine: After [[TSR, Inc.]] was purchased by [[Wizards of the Coast]] in 1997, publication continued briefly, from [[Polyhedron 142|''Polyhedron'' #142]] to [[Polyhedron 148|''Polyhedron'' #148]]. In [[Polyhedron 148|''Polyhedron'' #148]], it was announced that ''Polyhedron'' and [[Dungeon magazine|''Dungeon magazine'']] were to be merged into one single publication, with dual-numbering for each separate publication. <ref>{{Cite polyhedron/148/Network News}}
History.Paizo: [[Paizo Publishing]] began publishing ''Polyhedron'' in September 2002 until it's final issue in August 2004. This marked the end of the association of ''Polyhedron'' and the RPGA. These issues had a focus on the d20 system.

Content.Forgotten Deities: ''[[Forgotten Deities]]'' was a column by [[Eric L. Boyd]]. The column focused on lesser-known gods that hadn't yet received a full write-up in other supplements.<ref>{{Cite polyhedron/103/Forgotten Deities: Amaunator}}
Content.The Living City: ''[[The Living City (column)|The Living City]]'' was a column by various authors. This column centred on the RPGA [[The Living City|Living City]] Adventures, set in [[Ravens Bluff]]. It explored various establishments, organizations and individuals. It also offered several adventures for players.
